refnamediv.refpurpose: Manage short aliases for running applications

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Normally to run a Flatpak app from the command line you specify the full App ID (and optionally the arch and branch) to the flatpak run command. This can be tedious, so the alias command allows you to set up aliases that can be passed to flatpak run instead. Once set up, no additional confirmation prompts are needed each time the alias is used.

The REF argument is a full or partial identifier for an app in the flatpak ref format, which looks like "app/ID/ARCH/BRANCH". All elements except ID are optional and can be left out, including the slashes, so most of the time you need only specify ID. Any part left out will be matched against what is installed, and if there are multiple matches you will be prompted to choose one of them.
The ALIAS argument is a string which can only contain the ASCII characters "[A-Z][a-z][0-9]_-".
To list the current set of aliases, run this command without any patterns.

Aliases are created as files in an aliases subdirectory of the relevant installation directory. However, it is not recommended to add this directory to your PATH since Flatpaks cannot handle file arguments like OS packages. For example, a command such as media-player ~/some-file.ogg would not work if the relevant Flatpak doesn't have home directory access. To provide access to particular files specified on the command line, use the --file-forwarding option documented in flatpak-run2.
